article.headline: Elon 73, Navy 58
article.story: ANNAPOLIS, Md. -- Drew Spradlin scored 14 points to lead four players in double figures as Elon defeated Navy 73-58 on Wednesday night. Spradlin hit four 3-pointers and Chris Long, who scored 13 points, had three for the Phoenix (5-7), who entered the game third in the country with an average of 10.1 3-pointers a game, and went 13 of 33 (39.4 percent). Elon led most of the game, but Navy (4-9), which has lost three straight games, grabbed a 53-51 lead on the three-point play by Jordan Sugars with 5:25 remaining. Spradlin countered with a 3-pointer for a 54-53 lead and after two free throws, Sebastian Koch followed with another 3-pointer for a 59-54 advantage with 3:28 remaining. Elon outscored Navy 22-5 in the final 5:25. Koch finished with 11 points, Jack Isenbarger added 10 and Roger Dugas had 13 rebounds. Sugars led Navy with 21 points. Elon outrebounded Navy 46-27.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
